text: Hi guys! I'm using actions.fetchCrmObjectProperties and i want to know if we have a method to retrieve label too ( not just the value ) of the properties , thanks
unfortunately no, you have to hit the properties endpoint through a serverless function and match them up. It would be so awesome though if there was a label value pair like graphql though

:mega: ahead of the holidays, the crm components & page editor teams have a few gifts for you all :gift:
• CRM statistics component (screenshot 1): a brand new component that renders data summaries calculated from the currently displaying CRM record’s associations. for example, you can use this component to display data such as the average revenue of all of a contact’s associated companies or the maximum number of days to close from all of a company’s associated deals (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extension-components#crm-statistics|see dev docs>).
• stage tracker on all CRM objects & custom objects: you can now display the stage tracker on all CRM objects, including custom objects, to show how the record is progressing (screenshot 2). contact and company records are based on lifecycle stage and custom objects are based on pipeline if one exists (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extension-components#stage-tracker|see dev docs>). admins can also now configure up to four properties in card settings (screenshot 3).
• edit & autosave properties (screenshot 4): we heard your feedback and users can now edit and autosave properties in property list, association property list, and stage tracker cards! this will allow them to quickly make edits and keep them in the context of their workflow.
Is there any method I can use to implement a callback function when an iframe I have opened is closed? - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/create-ui-extensions#open-an-iframe-in-a-modal>
